intro: Gaertnera malcomberiana, commonly known as the Malcomber's gaertnera, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually simple, opposite, and have a slightly hairy texture. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
